content:
Content: The artwork depicts a scene of war and its consequences, such as death, destruction, and suffering.

Context: Y no hai remedio (And There’s Nothing to Be Done) is part of the series Los Desastres de la Guerra (The Disasters of War) by Spanish painter and printmaker Francisco de Goya. The series was created between 1810 and 1820, during the Peninsular War, and reflects the horrors of the war and its impact on civilians.

Function: The artwork serves as a political and social commentary on the effects of war and serves as a warning against its destructive consequences. It is a powerful anti-war statement and a testament to the human suffering caused by conflict.
